files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Client.BlendedOverlayTexture
files.Summary: Defines a texture to be overlayed on another texture. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Client.CompositeTexture
files.Summary: Holds data about a texture. Also allows textures to be overlayed on top of one another. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Client.EnumChunkRenderPass
files.Summary: The various render passes available for rendering blocks Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Client.EnumDrawType
files.Summary: Draw types for blocks. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Client.EnumFaceCullMode
files.Summary: Types that determine how block faces should be culled. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Client.WorldInteraction
files.Summary: A world interaction for the object. This is used to prompt the player about what a certain object can do. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.AdvancedParticleProperties
files.Summary: Used to add a set of particle properties to a collectible. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.AnimationMetaData
files.Summary: Animation Meta Data is a json type that controls how an animation should be played. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.AnimationSound
files.Summary: Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.AnimationTrigger
files.Summary: Data about when an animation should be triggered. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.AssetLocation
files.Summary: Defines a complete path to an assets, including it's domain. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.BakingProperties
files.Summary: Baking Properties are collectible attribute used for baking items in a clay oven. You will need to add these attributes if using inside . Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.BlockBehavior
files.Summary: Allows for definitions of behaviors of a block that can be applied to any block See the derived types for a list of all documented block behaviors. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.BlockDropItemStack
files.Summary: Represents an itemstack that is dropped when breaking a block, with a potentially random quantity. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.BlockEntityBehaviorType
files.Summary: Allows adding behaviors for block entities. Remember, block entities are specific instances of blocks placed within the world. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.BlockSounds
files.Summary: A set of sounds that are defined for a block. All fields use default or empty sounds if not set. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.CollectibleBehavior
files.Summary: A behavior object which can be added to any collectible. See the derived types for a list of documented collectible behaviors. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.CombustibleProperties
files.Summary: Marks an item as combustible, either by cooking, smelting or firing. This can either imply it is used as a fuel, or can be cooked into another object. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.CompositeShape
files.Summary: Holds shape data to create 3D representations of objects. Also allows shapes to be overlayed on top of one another recursively. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.CraftingRecipeIngredient
files.Summary: A crafting recipe ingredient Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.CreativeTabAndStackList
files.Summary: Allows you to add a list of item stacks to put various into creative menu tabs. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.CrushingProperties
files.Summary: Defines a set of properties that allow an object to be ground in a quern. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.Entities.BaseSpawnConditions
files.Summary: A base class for entities spawning conditions. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.Entities.ClimateSpawnCondition
files.Summary: A list of conditions based on climate. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.Entities.EnumEntityActivity
files.Summary: A list of activities that an entity can perform. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.Entities.QuantityByGroup
files.Summary: Allows you to control spawn limits based on a set of entity codes using a wildcard. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.Entities.RuntimeSpawnConditions
files.Summary: A set of spawn conditions for chunks that have already been generated. Most properties are got from . Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.Entities.SpawnConditions
files.Summary: The spawn conditions assigned to various things. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.Entities.WorldGenSpawnConditions
files.Summary: A set of spawn conditions for when chunks are generated. Most properties are got from . Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumAICreatureType
files.Summary: Types of creatures used for pathfinding. Humanoids prefer taking paths. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumAnimationBlendMode
files.Summary: Defines how multiple animations should be blended together. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumAppSide
files.Summary: A server/client side used by for the Vintage Story app. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumBlockMaterial
files.Summary: Materials of which a block may be made of. Currently only used for mining speed for tools and blast resistance. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumFoodCategory
files.Summary: Types of nutrition for foods. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumGetClimateMode
files.Summary: The type of climate values you wish to receive Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumHabitat
files.Summary: Habitats for entities. Controls some minor logic for entities. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumItemClass
files.Summary: The type of collectible in an itemstack. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumItemDamageSource
files.Summary: Types for how an item can damage it's durability. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumLightLevelType
files.Summary: Used in blockAccessor.GetLightLevel() to determine what kind of light level you want Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumMatterState
files.Summary: Various states of matter to use for collectibles. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumMouseButton
files.Summary: A list of mouse buttons. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumParticleModel
files.Summary: Types of model for a particle. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumRandomizeAxes
files.Summary: When picking a random seed for this block, what axes should we base it on? Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumShapeFormat
files.Summary: Types of shape that can be loaded by the game. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumSmeltType
files.Summary: The type of smelting for the collectible. This effects how the object is smelted. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumSoilNutrient
files.Summary: The three types of soil nutrient for farmland and crops. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumTool
files.Summary: Types for each tool in the game. Some of these are unused. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.EnumTransitionType
files.Summary: Types of transition for items. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.FoodNutritionProperties
files.Summary: Allows you to make collectibles edible, and adds data about their nutrition. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.GridRecipe
files.Summary: Represents a crafting recipe to be made on the crafting grid. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.GrindingProperties
files.Summary: Defines a set of properties that allow an object to be ground in a quern. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.HeldSounds
files.Summary: Defines a set of sounds for a collectible object. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.JsonItemStack
files.Summary: This is a representation of an item stack in JSON. It resembles a standard in-game item stack but can be stored before the game is loaded. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.LayeredVoxelRecipe<T>
files.Summary: Creates a recipe using a 3D voxel-based system. Used for recipes types such as clayforming, smithing, or stone-knapping.

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.ModelTransform
files.Summary: Used for transformations applied to a block or item model. Uses values from but will assign defaults if not included. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.ModelTransformNoDefaults
files.Summary: Controls the transformations of 3D shapes. Note that defaults change depending on where this class is used. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.RecipeBase<T>
files.Summary: Creates a new base recipe type. Almost all recipe types extend from this.

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.TransitionableProperties
files.Summary: This is a versatile way of allowing a collectible to change to another after a certain time in the inventory. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Common.VertexFlags
files.Summary:
Special class to handle the vertex flagging in a very nicely compressed space.
Bit 0-7: Glow level
Bit 8-10: Z-Offset
Bit 11: Reflective bit
Bit 12: Lod 0 Bit
Bit 13-24: X/Y/Z Normals
Bit 25, 26, 27, 28: Wind mode
Bit 29, 30, 31: Wind data (also sometimes used for other data, e.g. reflection mode if Reflective bit is set, or additional water surface data if this is a water block)
Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.Datastructures.RotatableCube
files.Summary: A rotatable version of a cuboid. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.MathTools.Cuboidf
files.Summary: Represents a three dimensional axis-aligned cuboid using two 3D coordinates. Used for collision and selection boxes. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.MathTools.Cuboidi
files.Summary: A 3D cuboid, created out of integers. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumColorBlendMode
files.Summary: Specifies types of per-pixel color blending. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumCombination
files.Summary: Used to define how variant types interact with each other to create unique objects. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumDistribution
files.Summary: The distribution of the random numbers Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EnumTransformFunction
files.Summary: Used for EvolvingNatFloat value transforms Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.MathTools.EvolvingNatFloat
files.Summary: A number generator whose return value changes over time, parametrized by a transform function and some constants Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.MathTools.NatFloat
files.Summary: A more natural random number generator (nature usually doesn't grow by the exact same numbers nor does it completely randomly) Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.MathTools.Size3f
files.Summary: Represents a vector of 3 floats. Go bug Tyron of you need more utility methods in this class. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.API.MathTools.Vec2f
files.Summary: Represents a vector of 2 floats. Go bug Tyron of you need more utility methods in this class. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.AlloyRecipe
files.Summary: This is used to define what metals can be mixed together to create another type of metal inside of a crucible. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BarrelOutputStack
files.Summary: Defines an output for use in a . This object takes most of its properties from the class. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BarrelRecipe
files.Summary: Creates a recipe for use inside a barrel. Primarily used to craft with liquids. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BarrelRecipeIngredient
files.Summary: Defines an ingredient for use in a . Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BehaviorCollectFrom
files.Summary:
When this block is right clicked, harvest its drops and replace it with an empty version. Uses the code "CollectFrom". This behavior has no properties.

Note that this behavior requires a variant which ends in "-empty", and also requires at least two drops. The first drop should be the item to collect, the second drop is the block itself. See 'henbox.json' for an example. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BehaviorElevatorControl
files.Summary: Used in combination with the "BEBehaviorElevatorControl" to create an elevator. Uses the code "ElevatorControl", and has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BehaviorMyceliumHost
files.Summary: Allows a block to have mushrooms naturally spawn on it. Uses the code "MyceliumHost", and has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorBreakIfFloating
files.Summary: Forces the Block to drop as an item when surrounded by air blocks. It will override drops returned by the Block when this happens. Uses the code "BreakIfFloating". This behavior doesn't use any properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorBreakSnowFirst
files.Summary: A simple block behavior that breaks a snow cover first, before breaking the block. Uses the code "BreakSnowFirst". This behavior has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorCanAttach
files.Summary: Allows some other blocks, such as torches, to be attached onto specific sides of this block. Uses the code "CanAttach". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorCanIgnite
files.Summary: Used if the attached block can ignite other blocks with Shift + Right Click. This behavior uses the code "CanIgnite", and has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorChimney
files.Summary: If this block is placed directly above a smoke emitter (such as a firepit or pit kiln), smoke particles will be emitted. Uses the code "chimney" and has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorContainer
files.Summary: Specifies that this block works as a container. Note that it requires a block entity class which implements BlockEntityOpenableContainer. Used with the code "Container". This behavior does not use any properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorCreatureContainer
files.Summary: Allows a creature to be contained inside of this block, as well as catching and releasing the entity. Note that this behavior is built around use with the reed chest, and may have unexpected results with other blocks. This behavior uses the code "CreatureContainer", and has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorDecor
files.Summary: Allows this block to be placed on the side of another block, as a decorational shape/texture. Uses the code "decor". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorDoor
files.Summary: A block behavior for a door. Also requires the "door" block entity behavior type on a block to work. Defined with the "Door" code. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorDropNotSnowCovered
files.Summary: Drops the non-snow-covered block, when the snow covered version one is destroyed. This behavior uses the "DropNotSnowCovered" code, and has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorExchangeOnInteract
files.Summary: Allows a block to swap between a set of states on activation. Note that this behavior has some small hardcoding for legacy trapdoors. This behavior is used with the code "ExchangeOnInteract". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorFiniteSpreadingLiquid
files.Summary: Used to create a liquid which distrubutes itself over an area, and has interaction with other liquids. Uses the "FiniteSpreadingLiquid" code. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorGiveItemPerPlayer
files.Summary: Passes functions through to the block entity behavior. Therefore, requires that. Uses the "GiveItemPerPlayer" code. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorHarvestable
files.Summary: Allows a block to be harvested with the right mouse button for set items. Uses the code "harvestable". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorHeatSource
files.Summary: Allows this block to work as a heat source for entities. BlockEntities for a block with this behavior may also define their own custom heat strength. Uses the code "HeatSource". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorHorizontalAttachable
files.Summary: Forces a block to only allow placement on the side of another block. Requires use of the "horizontalorientation" variant group. Uses the code "HorizontalAttachable". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorHorizontalOrientable
files.Summary: Allows a block to automatically rotate between the four horizontal directions based on placement angle. Requires use of the "horizontalorientation" variant group. Uses the "HorizontalOrientable" code. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorJonasBoilerDoor
files.Summary: Provides interaction for the JonasBoilerDoor block entity behavior. Uses the "JonasBoilerDoor" code. This behavior has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorJonasGasifier
files.Summary: Passes functions to the block entity behavior, and therefore requires that. Uses the code "JonasGasifier". This behavior has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorJonasHydraulicPump
files.Summary: Passes functions to the block entity behavior, and therefore requires that. Uses the code "JonasHydraulicPump". This behavior has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorLadder
files.Summary: Used to control ladder behavior, including horizontal orientation, placement, collection. Note that this does not control how entities react to ladders (see "climbable" in blocktype). Requires use of the 'horizontalorientation' variants. Uses the code "Ladder". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorLockable
files.Summary: Allows a block to be locked by a player with a padlock, preventing any interaction from any other players. Uses the "lockable" code. This behavior has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorMilkingContainer
files.Summary: Allows a block to be used as a container for milking an entity. Must be on a block that has the "BlockLiquidContainerBase" class. Uses the code "MilkingContainer", and has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorMultiblock
files.Summary: Turns this block into a multiblock, allowing it to be larger than a single block. By default, all blocks will have the same properties. If you need different properties or functionality for each block section, you will need to use a new block class. Uses the code "Multiblock". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorNWOrientable
files.Summary: Automatically swaps between 'North/South' and 'West/East' variants based on placement rotation. Requires an "orientation" or "side" variant with the codes "ns" and "we". Uses the code "NWOrientable", and has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorOmniAttachable
files.Summary: Allows a block to be attached to any face, including vertical faces. Requires states from "abstract/horizontalorientation", as well as additional "up" and "down" states. Uses the code "OmniAttachable". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorPillar
files.Summary: Used to rotate a block that has a 'top' face, such as a wooden log. Requires a "rotation" variant group with "ud", "ns", "we" states. Uses the "pillar" code. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorPushEventOnBlockBroken
files.Summary: Publishes the BlockPos when a Block is broken with the given event name. Likely used in tandem with code mods. Uses the "PushEventOnBlockBroken" code. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorRainDrip
files.Summary: Makes a block emit rain particles during or after rainy weather. Uses the "RainDrip" code. This behavior has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorReinforcable
files.Summary: Allows a block to be reinforced, which protects against it being broken as quickly. Appropriate blocks are automatically given this behavior. This behavior is not added through the normal property, but instead a custom attribute. This behavior has no properties. You can add the "reinforcable" attribute to force an object to be reinforcable. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorReparable
files.Summary: Blocks which can be repaired using glue. If not repaired, they will shatter (dropping nothing) when broken. Requires use of the ShapeFromAttributes block entity behavior. Uses the code "Reparable". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorRightClickPickup
files.Summary: Allows a block to be picked up with a right click. Uses the code "RightClickPickup". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorRopeTieable
files.Summary: Allows rope to be tied to this block. This behavior does not have any specific JSON properties. This block behavior uses the code "RopeTieable". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorSlab
files.Summary: Unused block behavior for slab placement. Consider using instead. Uses the "slab" code. This behavior has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorSneakPlacing
files.Summary: Forces a block to only allow to be placed when the player is sneaking. Uses the code "SneakPlacing". This behavior has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorSnowballable
files.Summary: Allows a block to have snowballs taken from it. Many blocks automatically receive this behavior if they have a snow layer or the SnowballableDecrementedBlockCode attribute. Uses the code 'Snowballable'. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorSteaming
files.Summary: Makes a block emit steam particles, and also marks some water blocks as 'boiling'. Uses the code "Steaming". This behavior has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorTransformBreak
files.Summary: When a block with this behavior is broken. it will turn into another specified block instead of air. This block behavior uses the code "TransformBreak". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorTrapDoor
files.Summary: Marks a block as an animated trapdoor. Requires the use of the block entity behavior. Uses the "TrapDoor" code. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorUnplaceable
files.Summary: Disallows standard placement for this block. If a previous listed behavior allows a special placement method (see ), then that method will be allowed. Uses the "unplaceable" code. This behavior has no properties. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorUnstable
files.Summary: Only allows a block to exist if it is attached to another block. Uses the code "unstable". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorUnstableFalling
files.Summary: Spawns an EntityBlockFalling when the user places a block that has air underneath it or if a neighbor block is removed and causes air to be underneath it. Also has optional functionality to prevent a block being placed if it is unstable. Uses the code "UnstableFalling". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorUnstableRock
files.Summary: Makes a block potentially unstable, but can be held up using support beams. This behavior will only function if the "caveIns" world config is set to true. Uses the code "UnstableRock". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.BlockBehaviorWrenchOrientable
files.Summary: Allows a block to cycle through variants when using a wrench. Uses the code "WrenchOrientable". Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.ClayFormingRecipe
files.Summary: Creates a recipe that can be created using clay. This class takes all of its properties from the class. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.CookingRecipe
files.Summary: Defines a recipe to be made using a cooking pot. Creating a new recipe for a cooking pot will automatically register the new meal item, unless using . Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.CookingRecipeIngredient
files.Summary: An ingredient for a . Note that each ingredient can have multiple valid itemstacks that satisfy the ingredient. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.CookingRecipeStack
files.Summary: An itemstack specific for a . Most properties are extended from . Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.KnappingRecipe
files.Summary: Defines a stone/flint knapping recipe. Uses all properties from , however always uses a single layer. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.MetalAlloyIngredient
files.Summary: Defines an ingredient for a recipe. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.GameContent.SmithingRecipe
files.Summary: Defines a smithing recipe, to be created on an anvil. Uses a total of 6 layers, and gets its properties from . Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.BlockBehaviorOmniRotatable
files.Summary: Allows complex rotation of a block depending on placement angle. Also has behavior of placing the block in the crafting grid to set a 'slab placement mode'. Requires the "rot" variant with the 6 directional states. Uses the "OmniRotatable" code. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.BlockCropPropertiesType
files.Summary: Used for crop blocks that grow over time. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.BlockType
files.Summary: Defines an in-game block using a json file. BlockTypes use all properties from and , but also contain some unique properties. Any json file placed in your "assets/blocktypes" folder will be loaded as a blocktype in the game. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.ClientEntityConfig
files.Summary: Specific configuration settings for entities on the client-side. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.CollectibleBehaviorType
files.Summary: A type of behavior to attach to a object. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.CollectibleType
files.Summary: A type of in-game collectible object. Extends from . This is mainly used to control items (and block's items) when they are in the inventory. s get most of their data from here, s use this as well as their own specific data. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.CropBehaviorType
files.Summary: Allows further complex behavior for crop blocks. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.EntityType
files.Summary: An entity type. Any json files inside of assets/entities will be loaded in as this type. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.EnumJsonPatchOp
files.Summary: A set of operations that define what a patch will do. See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6902#section-4.1 for more information on each operation type. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.ItemType
files.Summary: Defines an in-game item using a json file. Note that all json properties for items come from the base and classes. Any json file inside the "assets/itemtypes" folder will be loaded as an itemtype in the game. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.JsonPatch
files.Summary: Defines a patch for a json asset. This allows modifying json files through mods without directly editing them. To help with creating patches, it is highly recommended to learn how to use the in-built modmaker program. See https://wiki.vintagestory.at/Modding:Inbuilt_ModMaker for more info. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.PatchCondition
files.Summary: A condition for a json patch. Conditions are based on the currently loaded worldconfig. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.PatchModDependence
files.Summary: A mod-dependence for a json patch. If your patch depends on another mod, you need to use this. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.RegistryObjectType
files.Summary: The very base class for an in-game object. Extended by blocktypes, itemtypes, and entitytypes. Controls the object's code, variant types, allowed/disallowed variants, world interactions, and a class for extra functionality. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.NoObf.ServerEntityConfig
files.Summary: Specific configuration settings for entities on the server-side. Open in GitHub

files.Title: Vintagestory.ServerMods.RegistryObjectVariantGroup
files.Summary: This is used to define a set of variant groups for specific registry objects. Open in GitHub
